intro: Aquilegia vulgaris var. ruscinonensis, commonly known as the Ruscinonensis Columbine, is a cultivar of the common columbine. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers with distinctive spurred petals. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans and is known for its hardy nature. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. This variety is prized in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
